definition: to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize

sentences.english: He snatched the old lady's purse and ran.
sentences.chinese: 他搶了那老婦的銀包，拔腿就跑。

sentences.english: And the Hare took to her heels and luckily escaped.
sentences.chinese: 然後拔腿就跑，並幸運地逃脫危險。

sentences.english: I ran away after I heard a tsunami was coming.
sentences.chinese: 我聽到海嘯要來後拔腿就跑。
投資人理所應當地拔腿逃跑。

sentences.english: I got up, put my pants on, and got out of there.
sentences.chinese: 我爬起來，穿上褲子，拔腿就跑。

sentences.english: Kono with a bad look and and ran upstairs. Iron peak haze?
sentences.chinese: 河野滿一看不妙拔腿就往樓上跑。

sentences.english: We all got really scared and ran.
sentences.chinese: 我們都嚇壞了，拔腿就跑。

sentences.english: The man break into a run when he see the police.
sentences.chinese: 那人一見到警察，拔腿就跑。

sentences.english: Police arrived at the scene, several people saw the police run away.
sentences.chinese: 警方抵達現場後，有幾人看到警察拔腿就跑。

sentences.english: With a strangled cry, the assassin dropped from the tree and hit the ground. He began to run.
sentences.chinese: 刺客忽然大叫一聲，從樹上跳到地上，拔腿就跑。

sentences.english: I chased the other half-way around the school yard.
sentences.chinese: 我拔腿去追另一個，追到校園中間。

sentences.english: The punks bolted, vanishing among the parked cars.
sentences.chinese: 小混混們拔腿就跑，消失在停車場內的車輛之間。

sentences.english: When the thief saw the dog making for him, he ran away.
sentences.chinese: 這個竊賊看見狗撲向他時，拔腿就跑。

sentences.english: Jack and Hughie scrambled to their feet and ran, the doll forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 傑克和胡伊拔腿就跑，忘了手中的娃娃。

sentences.english: When he emerged at the quarry he felt secure, and so he picked up his nimble heels and flew.
sentences.chinese: 到了石坑那邊，他覺得安全了，拔腿就跑，一路飛奔。

sentences.english: He started to run away and barged against a passer-by.
sentences.chinese: 他拔腿跑開，和一個過路人撞個滿懷。

definition: to take to one's heels/to scram
(dialect) to rush off/to scamper off double-quick/to take to one's heels/to make oneself scarce
to rush out through a door (idiom)
like a wisp of smoke/(to disappear etc) in an instant
rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
to leave in stealth/to slip away
to turn on one's heels/to walk away abruptly
in a great rush/in a flurry
